Posts.Content: That's a tough question. Unless you plan on shaving your head for the next ten years, it could be said that a photo of you without hair would be more misleading than one of you in a wig. I suspect the better answer is the wig - I'm not sure you'd be allowed to wear a headscarf or similar. Most women don't keep their hair exactly the same for 10 years so a few minutes in the booth with a wig on is probably the simplest answer. But here are the contact details for the passport office helpline and I'm sure you're not the first person to have to ask such a question.

Posts.Content: I don't have the 'directional problems' that you describe but I have a sheewee - admittedly not in the bright pink in your link. I go to India every year and I have to sometimes use toilets that would turn your stomach. Boys are naturally endowed with the equipment to keep as far away as possible from what me might call the business end of a squat toilet. Once you've tried one of these you'll be dead jealous that we girls don't get to pee standing up. They were invented for women in the army (there are combat versions available - I kid you not) and for people going to Glastonbury (other outdoor festivals with stinky portaloos exists) and they are actually rather fun. Don't forget to lift the seat, ladies.

Posts.Content: On a practical note, I just discovered a gizmo that might be useful to anybody who's been watching their hair disappear down the plug hole after chemo. I've not been in that situation but I had a bit of a blockage and bought some hair clog removal tools on Amazon.  You get a five-pack for £5.59.  Simply thread it down the plug hole and pull. I got a lump the size of a large mouse out of mine. You may want to give the job to a loved one as I can imagine it would be pretty upsetting to see the evidence in that way but it will unclog your pipes.
Posts.Title: Does anyone else dislike the Macmillan Brave the Shave campaign?

Posts.Content: Maybe it sounds strange but in contrast to BtheS, I REALLY like the Movember campaign where men grow moustaches and then shave them off to raise awareness and money for testicular and prostate cancer.  Many men look funny with a tash - many who've had them for years look funny without them. The growing takes weeks and keeps the awareness high and I think it's a fun campaign. Shaving your head though? Not so funny. I think many of us who've had non-chemo cancers - or cancers where the chemo doesn't cause hair loss - get a bit tired of people asking "So will you lose your hair then?" when we're diagnosed. People can lose so much in so many ways and this focus on hair is not always helpful. I also feel rather sad for people with alopoecia who are constantly being asked if they are sick because of the equation in people's minds - hair loss equals cancer. Two British women athletes in the Olympics (Jo Rowsell and one of the rugby 7s ladies) both brought that thought to my mind.

Posts.Content: I didn't have breast cancer so I'm no expert but I have read a lot of autobiographical books about different cancers and one I rated very highly is called The Glass Half Full by Elizabeth Glasson. You can find it on Amazon https://www.amazon.co.uk/Glass-Half-breast-cancer-revisited-ebook/dp/B006RMH7QK/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8&qid=1465160080&sr=8-1&keywords=glass+half+full+breast+cancer where it will cost you less than £1.50 if you have a kindle or other e-reader. I had some contact with the author after she saw a review I wrote about the book a few years back. She told me that a lot of people got quite 'nasty' with her because she has a husband with a good business and could afford an au pair to help out, and some readers seemed to resent that. BUT if you want a down to earth and really rather positive personal experience, I can recommend this one.

Posts.Content: That's a terrible dilemma for you to face. But I think you should listen to your oncologist and ask him why it can't wait. It may be that it's just more efficient for the hospital (in which case you can challenge the timing) or it might be that he really does think you are at risk if you delay it. Posts.Content: Oh my goodness, LondonLass, it would appear that you have been judged and found to have inadequately performed in your role as a cancer 'victim'. Please take a few minutes on the naughty step to address your offending behaviour. But seriously, who knows more about your cancer - you or these silly people? Who knows more about how you're feeling and coping - you or these silly people, most of whom have probably garnered their knowledge of cancer from too many over-blown articles in the Daily Wail or from whispered overheard discussions about somebody's sister's hairdresser's friend who was diagnosed one day and dead the next of some totally unrelated - and quite possibly fictitious - eyelash cancer? They mean well - maybe - but they're also feeding off the vicarious thrill of other people's illness and you're letting them down by not having a good moan and telling them your only remaining wish is to base-jump off the Trump Tower in your underwear. You are not the one who is not facing reality. You're just not performing to their unrealistic and pessimistic ill-informed expectations. Have a good scream and kick the wheelie bin and the next time somebody asks, throw yourself at their feet and beg for mercy for not giving them what they want.  Have a great Christmas and don't let these idiots make you doubt yourself.

Posts.Content: I would say you've done exactly the right thing. I never accept a request from somebody I haven't seen around the site. I know some people worry that "This might be somebody in terrible need who is too shy to post" but all too often it's somebody trying to ask to borrow your bank account for their 'father the president' to launder his missing millions or people who want to sell you dodgy snake-oil therapies. I would say that if you wouldn't accept a stranger's request on Facebook or other social media, exercise the same caution here - and if you do accept and have an unpleasant experience, let the admins know and they will ban those users almost immediately.
